timeline.summary: This document is a redaction analysis concerning case EFTA00032994. It details an email from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding Reginald Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-059), referencing the discontinuation of "Psych Ops" on July 30, 2018, at 8:15 am, and includes a file named TEXT.htm.

This document is a Lieutenant’s log and daily activities report for Saturday, July 6, 2019, produced by the 9th Metropolitan Connectional Center located at 150 Path Gow, New York. It includes files named “TEXT.htm,” “LIEUTENANT’S LOG 07-06-2019.docm,” and “Daily Activities Report 7-06-2019.docx.” The report is classified as CONFIDENTIAL, referencing case numbers SDNY_000 10271 and EFTA00034134.

This document concerns a psych observation conducted on Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM. The observation was performed by an "I/M companion," and the file (EFTA00035061) is corrupted and unopenable. Correspondence regarding the observation was exchanged between individuals with redacted email addresses.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on July 10, 2019, regarding a "Suicide Watch" under the case number EFTA00035291. The email included a forensic observation of patient E stein #76318-054 and a closing statement from EFTA00035292.

On July 10, 2019, a Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) notified [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] about Jared Epstein’s removal from psychiatric observation and the availability of notes regarding his situation. A POFU (Pending Order for Use of Force) was requested for tomorrow, July 11, 2019, due to a crisis. The communication referenced inmate EFTA00035269.

On July 11, 2019, an inmate identified as Epstein was located at the SHU (Special Housing Unit) and subsequently at Legal. The communication was between “” and [REDACTED]. The case reference is EFTA00035294.
This document, labeled EFTA00035553, is a production report titled "Prisoner Production 07-15-2019." It includes the files TEXT.htm, NYM 07-15-2019.pdf, and BRO_07-15-2019.pdf, dated July 12, 2019.

This document comprises records related to Lieutenant activity on Sunday, July 14, 2019, including a lieutenant’s log, a daily activity report, and supporting documents (TEXT.htm, LIEUTENANT’S LOG 07-14-2019.docm, Daily Activities Report 7-14.2019.docx). The documents are associated with the case EFTA00034538 and designated as CONFIDENTIAL.

This document concerns Prisoner Production data from July 15, 2019, specifically referencing files named TEXT.htm, NYM 07-15-2019.pdf, and BRO 07-15-2019.pdf. The data is associated with case number SDNY_00011970 and EFTA00034679. It was sent on July 7, 2019, and marked as CONFIDENTIAL.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden at FCI Estill informed recipients that Jeffrey Edward Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The email chain details this information and expresses surprise at the outcome.

This document is a Lieutenant’s log and daily activities report for Sunday, July 21, 2019, including associated files: TEXT.htm, LIEUTENANT’S LOG 07-21-2019.docm, and Daily Activities Report 7-21-2019.docx. It identifies a location as “15C Auk .R.04O” and references “EFTA00034907” and “SDNY_000 12839.”
On July 23, 2019, an update regarding a Suicide Watch was initiated for subject Epstein #76318-054 (EFTA00035691). A subsequent Psych Observation report indicated no observations.

An email was sent from “Captain” to [REDACTED] on July 23, 2019, regarding EFTA00035573, referencing a meeting at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The email included attachments named TEXT.htm and 2019_07_23_10_29_05.pdf.
On July 23, 2019, an inmate companion reported that inmate Epstein (#76318-054), who was under suicide watch, requested to speak with his attorney. The communication is documented in EFTA00035296.

An injury report for inmate Epstein was sent on July 23, 2019, from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED]. The report, labeled EFTA00035029, includes a TEXT.htm file and a ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf attachment. It details an injury incident.

A memo from Associate Warden at the MCC New York to Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center details a discrepancy between reported information and what was actually received regarding events involving Jeffrey Epstein. The memo includes attachments: a text file named TEXT.htm and a PDF file named 2019_07_23_10_29_05.pdf.
An individual requested a cutter from another person, citing an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein. The request included a mention of a cage and the absence of a cutter within it.

An email was sent on July 24, 2019, referencing Jeffrey Epstein and requesting that the recipient (identified as “tell me”) forward the email to their boss ("why does"). The sender, identified as “look what i just sent you about epstein,” expressed confusion about the recipient's role in distributing the email. The email is labeled EFTA00035539.

On July 24, 2019, an email was sent from an unknown sender to [REDACTED] regarding a “GAN” related to Jeffrey Epstein, noting that Epstein was placed on “Watch” following a phone call. The email attached a file named “TEXT.htm”.

An email was sent on July 24, 2019, inquiring about the MDS code for an individual identified as “Epstein.” The sender requested confirmation that “0140” was the correct start time and offered to enter codes for both parties. The email is associated with document EFTA00035271.

An email chain discusses concerns regarding a female inmate (“she”) and her interaction with a male subject (“him”) related to a Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) review (SRA).  Multiple individuals, including Chief Psychologists from the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons and Lt. Will, express the belief that the female inmate should conduct the report related to the SRA, citing her proximity to the incident and questioning her competence. A text file named TEXT.htm is attached.

On July 24, 2019, a Lieutenant within the U.S. Public Health Service and Federal Bureau of Prisons (Metropolitan Correctional Center) requested a change in observation status for inmate Epstein #76318-054. The request involved removing him from Suicide Watch and placing him on Psychological Observation, as documented in a memorandum from the MCC New York. A forensic report named “TEXT.htm” and a PDF file were attached to the communication.

This document is a Daily Activities Report/Lieutenants Log from July 25, 2019, generated by the Chief Psychologist of the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons, Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The report pertains to inmate EFTA00035274 and includes attachments named TEXT.htm and an unnamed embedded file.

A communication regarding a “Suicide Watch” was sent on July 26, 2019, concerning individual Epstein #76318-054. The communication included a text file named TEXT.htm and a note expressing gratitude, referencing EFTA00035306.

On July 30, 2019, IMI contacted Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding facility updates. The Associate Warden responded, stating they were “very busy with Epstein” and would get in contact. The email chain is attached as TEXT.htm.

On July 30, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York discussed a swap involving “Epstein drama” with an unknown recipient.  The conversation included inquiries about work being done on a project referred to as “Ill do” and referenced document EFTA00035651.

On July 30, 2019, at 6:42:58 PM, the Deputy United States Marshal from the Southern District of New York sent an email titled "Prisoner Production 07/31/2019" with attachments named TEXT.htm, MCC.PDF, and MDC.PDF. The email is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes the identifier SDNY_00013214 and EFTA00035022.

An email was sent on July 30, 2019, with the subject "EPSTEIN # 76318-054. EXTENSION CORD MEMO." It attached a document named “TEXT.htm” and “2019_07_30_14_13_49.pdf,” and included a note of thanks. The email relates to file EFTA00035518.

On July 30, 2019, Robert Roto (r roto@bop.gov) sent an email to Scott Skipperscott (sskipperscott@bop.gov) requesting a discussion regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s visiting forms. The email was marked as “Normal” importance and attached a file named “TEXT.htm.”

On July 31, 2019, an email was sent forwarding memos related to EFTA00034329. One memo was received without a signature from Ms. [REDACTED], and a plan was made to obtain her signature upon her return. The memos are classified as Confidential and linked to SDNY_00010699.

An email was sent on August 1, 2019, from [REDACTED] with the subject "Another f/u for next week." The email is flagged as “f/u,” “next week,” and references case number 76318-054 and “9S.” An attachment named TEXT.htm was included.

On August 1, 2019, an individual from R & D reported that Jeffrey Epstein, after returning from court, signed a form with Marshals indicating “suicidal tendencies.” He later denied this statement. The email also inquired about whether the individual was seeing Epstein and whether a Special Risk Assessment (SRA) was being conducted.

An email was sent from "To" [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 1, 2019, regarding the DHO docket for that date. The email requested assistance in ensuring all loss of privilege sanctions were correctly keyed by affected departments. The attachment included TEXT.htm and AUGUST_1,_2019.pdf. The document identifier is EFTA00035411.

An email was sent on August 2, 2019, forwarding reports related to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically the 583 and DHO reports. A SIS report was also expected to be sent later that day. The email includes attachments: TEXT.htm and Epstein_Documents.pdf.

This document is a Lieutenant’s log and daily activity log for Sunday, August 4, 2019, pertaining to EFTA00035704. It includes a Lieutenant’s log, a daily activity report, and supporting documents (TEXT.htm, LIEUTENANT’S_LOG_08-04-2019.docm, Daily_Activities_Report_8-04-2019.docx).
An email was sent from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to [REDACTED] on August 6, 2019, regarding EFTA00036963. The email is attached as TEXT.htm.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 6, 2019, forwarding a checklist for inmate requests for Protective Custody. The email included attachments: a TEXT.htm file, a PC Request Application in English, a PC Request Application in Spanish, and a PC Checklist.docx file. The checklist was dated 11/7/2016.

On August 8, 2019, an update regarding a Suicide Watch/Psych Observation was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED]. It concerns inmate file EFTA00036515. The observation includes Bright #76309-054, Benjamin #86463-054, Ramos #85428-054, and Almanzar #85978-054, all currently pending placement in a SHU bedspace.

An inmate, identified as EFTA00036519, is being placed on Suicide Watch. Psychological observation is scheduled, with no current findings and a pending Suicide Evaluation Bedspace (SEW). The communication originates from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 8, 2019.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] at bop.gov to [REDACTED] at thbop.gov with the subject "Assurance Statement" on August 8, 2019. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm and Assurance_Statement.pdf, related to EFTA00036915.
A memo was sent from EFTA00036311 to [REDACTED] on August 8, 2019, attached with a file named TEXT.htm. The memo contained redaction analysis related to EFTA00036311.

This document is a memo regarding “USE OF FORCE” at the 9 South unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, part of the U.S. Department of Justice’s Federal Bureau of Prisons. It was sent on August 8, 2019, and includes attached files: TEXT.htm, 9_south_USE_OF_FORCE.docx, and IMAGE.png. The sender is from the U.S. Department of Justice, Metropolitan Correctional Center, Federal Bureau of Prisons.

On August 9, 2019, a notification was sent to residents regarding an emergency water shut-off at Dayton Manor due to necessary repairs. The shut-off was scheduled from 10:20 AM to 12:00 PM. The email was sent from the Facilities Department to multiple recipients and included an attachment named TEXT.htm. Page 2 contains a message from the US Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, MDC Brooklyn, Facility Manager, with a motivational quote.

An email dated August 10, 2019, was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a “PSY ALERT.” The email inquired about the criteria for a PSY ALERT and specifically questioned why Jeffrey Epstein was not designated as such. The email is associated with file EFTA00035316.

A communication titled "M/W LOG" was sent from the U.S. Department of Justice (113OP MCC NV) to [REDACTED] on August 10, 2019, at 21:56:34 +0000. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm, Mw_Lieutenant_Log.pdf, and vcf (lieutenant). The redaction analysis pertains to EFTA00035357.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054, and includes a modified copy of his document. It’s a confidential communication from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to an unidentified recipient, dated August 10, 2019, with contact information for the facility. The document is labeled with case identifiers including SDNY_000 10732 and EFTA00034337.

This document is a draft notification, “Draft Notification,” attached to an email sent on August 10, 2019, at 5:13:13 PM. The email is addressed to and from redacted individuals, and the notification is marked as confidential and related to case SDNY_000 11159 and file EFTA00034501. It was intended for the Judge.

On August 10, 2019, at 22:20:02 +0000, an email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding discrepancies in count slips. The 12am count slip read 73, while the 12am El slip read 72. An attached file named EFTA00035359 was also sent.

A memo titled "memo Epstein" was sent on August 10, 2019, from the Bureau of Persons to [REDACTED]. The memo included attachments: TEXT.htm and memo_Emergency_Code_Epstein.docx. The sender's address was Bureau of Persons, 1 New Volt Park Rue, New York, NY 10007. The memo's subject is "Epstein".
An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a draft notification for the Judge, identified as EFTA00036063. The email included a file named TEXT.htm as an attachment.
An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 10, 2019, regarding document EFTA00036601. The email attached a file named TEXT.htm.

An email was sent on August 10, 2019, regarding an updated draft condolence letter (TEXT.htm) and a related document (Notification.Family.Eostein.death.docx). The email requests confirmation and signature of the letter before sending it to the intended recipient. The email includes confidentiality designations: SDNY_000 10256 and EFTA00034126.

An email from [REDACTED] with the subject “Psych Ops/Suicide watch” was sent on August 10, 2019, containing attachments: TEXT.htm and 2019_08_10_14_36_47.pdf (referenced as EFTA00036661). The email indicates the attached document contains requested information.

This document is a confidential communication, sent on August 10, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 76318-054). It originates from the Bureau of Prisons, specifically the MCC New York, and involves a clinical encounter finalized with a document named “TEXT.htm” and “ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf”. The communication is labeled as CONFIDENTIAL and includes case numbers SDNY_000 13092 and EFTA00035006.

This document is an email correspondence regarding a medical emergency that occurred on 9/10/19. It involves communication from the US Department of Justice, MCC-New York, regarding the event and associated files (TEXT.htm and 9.10.19 Medical Emeoerncy.docx). The email originates from the Communication Technician and is addressed to [REDACTED].

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] with the subject “Fwd: Draft Notification” on August 10, 2019. The email included a file named TEXT.htm and requested a review and feedback on a draft notification (EFTA00036681). The email was sent from a Samsung Galaxy smartphone.

This document is a redacted communication concerning Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. #76318-054). It originates from the Department of Justice, specifically a Clinical Nurse Specialist at the 131 Weatt of Prisons NR'C New York facility, referencing an emergency Code EPSTEIN and associated files including “TEXT.htm” and “ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf.” The communication is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes case number SDNY_000 11470.

An email chain discusses a timeline related to Jeffrey Epstein’s incarceration, referencing a DOJ timeline of July 29th and a logbook indicating his release on July 30th with an attorney visit throughout the day. The email includes attachments, including a TEXT.htm file.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 10, 2019, regarding document EFTA00035485. The email attached several files including TEXT.htm, 30_MINUTE_ROUNDS_8-8-19.pdf, 30_MINUTE_ROUNDS_8-9-19.pdf, 30_MINUTE_ROUNDS_8-10-19_1.pdf, and TRU-SCOPE_LOGS.pdf.
Email sent on August 10, 2019, regarding “Subject Count Slips,” including a document named TEXT.htm and 2019 08 10 17 10 00.pdf, labeled EFTA00035484. Attached information was requested.

This document is an email update regarding the timeline of investigations involving Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054). It includes two redaction notations and attachments named “TEXT.htm” and “Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Reg. No. 73618-054_1.docx”. The email is sent from an unknown sender to NYM/Executive Staff@bop.gov and is marked as CONFIDENTIAL.

An email was sent on August 10, 2019, forwarding an updated draft condolence letter regarding the death of someone named Epstein. The email includes attachments: a .htm file named TEXT.htm and a .docx file named Notification.Family.Epstein.death.docx, requesting a signature and sending to an addressee. The sender is EFTA00035428.

This document is a Lieutenant’s log and daily activity report for Saturday, August 10, 2019, including associated documents (TEXT.htm, Daily Activities Report 8-10-2019.docx, LIEUTENANT’S LOG 08-10-2019.docm). It references locations and organizations including Deutesuud, gedetal 33ateau of 3`'yboni, Metopetitan emotectional Centex, 150 .`Path gala, and SDNY_00008862, along with the EFTA00033614 file. The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL.

A draft condolence letter was sent from a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the CLC New York Metropolitan Correctional Center to [REDACTED] regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The letter was addressed to [REDACTED] and included a request for Epstein’s brother’s mailing address, along with attachments: TEXT.htm and Notification.Family.Epstein.death.docx.
A referral (TEXT.htm and 2019 08 10 15 39 08.pdf) was sent from [REDACTED] regarding case EFTA00036660 on August 10, 2019.

On August 10, 2019, an email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a potential leak concerning the death of Jeffrey Epstein, specifically related to hospital information. The email, flagged as urgent, requested that the information be provided to the OIG/FBI and included the file TEXT.htm.

An email chain discusses the death of Jeffrey Epstein while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) NY. The email, dated August 10, 2019, originates from EFTA00035431 and seeks answers regarding the circumstances of Epstein’s death, including notifications to his next of kin, life-saving measures taken, EMS and hospital involvement, FBI notification and investigation status, arrival date at MCC NY, and specific indictment details. An attached document, TEXT.htm, is referenced. The email also includes a link to a news article about Epstein’s death from abc13.com.
The email, dated August 10, 2019, concerns an initial timeline regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It includes three attachments: TEXT.htm, Epstein.docx, and 'cf'. The email is marked as "Normal" importance.

This document is an emergency report regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg # 76318-054) dated August 10, 2019. It was generated on December 27, 2025, and includes attachments named TEXT.htm and ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf. The report originates from the Bureau of Patient Control in New York.
A press release was updated regarding Michael Epstein’s case, including his arrival date and official charges. The original press release was attached as TEXT.htm and MCC_Epstein.docx.

An email chain discusses a draft notification related to an investigation, including one by the FBI and a request from the Attorney General for the DOJ Office of Inspector General to investigate. The emails are sent between individuals at [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] on August 10, 2019, with attachments including a text file named TEXT.htm. One email references a geospatial location known only by Skynet (Google). The document is identified as EFTA00036684.

An email correspondence, dated August 10, 2019, pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054_1) and includes an updated timeline. The email is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and associated with case number SDNY_00011167. It references attached documents: TEXT.htm and Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Req. No. 73618-054 1.docx.  “mc” is referenced as a contact for questions.

This document is a forwarded email chain concerning a memo titled "memo re: Epstein." The email originated on August 10, 2019, and references the file EFTA00034119.pdf, along with a document named TEXT.htm and a CONFIDENTIAL SDNY_000 10234 file. The sender and recipients are redacted.

A draft condolence letter regarding the death of someone named Epstein was sent. The letter, attached as TEXT.htm and Notification.Family.Epstein.death.docx, requires signing and sending to the addressee. The sender is EFTA00035364.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding “SHU rounds” attached to a document identified as EFTA00036671. The email was sent on August 11, 2019, at 19:28:46 +0000.  Two redactions are present on page 1 of the document.

An email was sent from “to” [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 11, 2019, with the subject “Memorandum(Epstein)” and the reference “EFTA00035488”. The email included the message “Information requested.” and attached a file named “TEXT.htm”.

An email exchange occurred between two individuals on August 11, 2019. One person expressed concern about a chaotic situation (“media shit show”) related to a news event and mentioned the US Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, and Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The other person indicated they were okay ("lmOK") and reported a busy shift. An attached file named “TEXT.htm” is also referenced.

This email chain pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s case file (Reg. No. 73618-054), specifically regarding Attorney Confidential Log Books (Parts 1-4). An Associate Warden at MCC New York sent an email referencing a physical “bog” (likely a document) and an attached HTML file (“TEXT.htm”). A reply confirms receipt of the attached file and reference to the EFTA00035208 case file.
An email was sent on August 11, 2019, with the subject “Roster.” The email contained two attachments: TEXT.htm and 2019 08 11 13 01 45.pdf, and identified the document as EFTA00036600.

A memorandum from “Epstein” to [REDACTED] regarding case EFTA00035466, titled “Captain,” originating from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York (150 Park Row, NY 10007).  Attached documents include TEXT.htm and a PDF named “2019 08 11 15 53 06.pdf”.

This document is a psychological observation report concerning Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) conducted between July 24th and July 30th, 1919. It utilized an “I/M companion” and later an “UM companion.” The report is labeled CONFIDENTIAL and associated with case number SDNY_00009646, and file EFTA00033924.

An email exchange occurred between an individual identified as "Captain" at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York and a Captain Secretary at the United States Penitentiary Leavenworth. The email subject was "Re: Hello," and included brief messages expressing well-being and checking in on each other. An attachment named “TEXT.htm” was sent.

A chronological log regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) was initially created using the wrong “tIM companion log” instead of the intended “Staff Suicide Watch log.” DTS identified the error and produced a second log utilizing the correct “Staff Suicide Watch log,” which contained identical entries and was initialed by Thomas. EFTA00035256 is referenced as the document identifier.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 12, 2019, regarding document #9, identified as EFTA00036647. The sender indicated, "I think this is it. Thanks!" and noted the document originated from the Northeast Region. Two redactions are present on page 1.

On August 12, 2019, the Federal Bureau of Prisons Northeast Regional Office sent photographs to [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] via email. The attachments included documents related to Jeffrey Epstein’s door, specifically six different .docx files named Epstein_door-1.docx through Epstein_door-6.docx, and a .htm file named TEXT.htm. The email originated from a “pecia Investigative Technician” at MCC New York.

An email dated August 12, 2019, from the Associate Warden at MCC New York to [REDACTED] regarding a “SW Chronological Log 7/23-24/19 re: Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Reg. No. 73618-054.” The email includes attachments named TEXT.htm and unnamed files, and references Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s registration number. The email states the sender forgot to include a CC recipient.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding documents #4, identified as EFTA00036649. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm; Ray_Ormond.vcf, and embedded files: unnamed; unnamed(1); unnamed(2); unnamed(3). The email originated on August 12, 2019, and was sent from the Northeast Region.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a breakdown of overtime (OT) in New York, related to the Samsung case EFTA00036650. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm and New_York_OT_Break_Down.docx. The email was sent on August 12, 2019, and is from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Northeast Regional Office.

On August 12, 2019, a Lieutenant from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (specifically, the United States Penitentiary at Florence, Colorado – Administrative Maximum) contacted someone (“baCK”) regarding a previous call. A subsequent communication occurred between the same Lieutenant and the United States Department of Justice’s Federal Bureau of Prisons, involving the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York. The case involved inmate EFTA00036321.

An email was sent from “[REDACTED]” to “[REDACTED]” on August 12, 2019, with the subject “Hello,” inquiring about the recipient. The email included an attachment named “TEXT.htm.” The document identifier is EFTA00036398.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding documents #6, identified as EFTA00036669. The email included attachments such as TEXT.htm and several unnamed embedded files. The email originated on August 12, 2019, and was related to the Northeast Region.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a roster titled “Roster,” dated August 12, 2019, associated with the Northeast Region and identified as EFTA00036676. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm, 2019 08 12 09 42 43.pdf, and vcf.

On August 12, 2019, an email was sent regarding a chronological log concerning Jeffrey Epstein, with an attached file named TEXT.htm. Staff observed Epstein during his initial watch period from 1:40am to 7am on July 23rd, with three subsequent emails planned.
An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding document EFTA00036674. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm, Rosters.pdf, and acf. The email was sent on August 12, 2019.

An email was sent from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to an unknown recipient regarding a “Watch Call.” The Warden expresses concern about the recipient’s well-being following a recent inmate suicide and offers assistance. An attached file named “TEXT.htm” was included.

A staff watch was initiated regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The initial log used was the “tIM companion log” instead of the “Staff Suicide Watch log.” David Coates corrected the error, creating a second log using the correct “Suicide Watch log,” which contained identical entries. The Associate Warden at MCC New York was also involved.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding a timeline of events involving Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054_1_1. The email includes attachments: TEXT.htm and Epsteinjeffrey_Edward,_Reg._No._73618-054_1_1.docx, and offers to provide further information.

This document is a chronological log concerning Jeffrey Epstein, registered as Edward with Reg. No. 73618-054, while incarcerated at MCC New York. It was sent on August 12, 2019, from the Associate Warden and includes references to “SW Chronological Log 7/23-24/19 re: Epstein, Jeffrey” and “TEXT.htm” and “ .vcf”. The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes the case number SDNY_00009678 and file number EFTA00033954.

An email was sent on August 12, 2019, requesting the gathering of information related to "Psychological Reconstruction" under the subject "Fwd: Psychological Reconstruction" and referencing file EFTA00035491. The email included a text file named TEXT.htm and an unnamed attachment.

An email exchange regarding a psychological observation of Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) conducted between 7/8/19 6 pm and 7/10/19 at 9 am. One party sent emails with attachments (“TEXT.htm”) related to the observation, but the recipient reported receiving corrupted files with the error “document cannot be opened because it is corrupted or damaged.” The email chain includes correspondence between the Associate Warden of MCC New York and a recipient, [REDACTED], and Lamine N’Diaye <Indiaye@bop.gov>. The file identifier is EFTA00035071.

This document is a psych observation report for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054, conducted between July 24th and July 30th, 2019. The observation utilized an “I/M companion” and included attachments: a text file (TEXT.htm) and a PDF document named “Epstein_Psych_Observation_7-24-30-2019.pdf”.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] regarding staff schedules. The email, dated August 12, 2019, attached a document named TEXT.htm (EFTA00036651) containing the requested information. Two redactions are present on page 1.
This document is an email regarding EFTA00035489. The email was sent on August 12, 2019, with attachments including TEXT.htm and a PDF file dated August 12, 2019, at 08:41:16 +0000.

An email exchange occurred between the Associate Warden of MCC New York and an individual identified as [REDACTED] on August 12, 2019. The email chain involved inquiries about the recipient’s well-being and offers of assistance. An attached file named “TEXT.htm” was also sent.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) and includes several related documents: a text file (TEXT.htm), psychological observation reports from July 8-30 and July 24-30, 2019, a social work chronological log from July 23 & 24, 19, a social work chronological log from July 23, 19, and correspondence from the Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding S/W and psych ops documents.

An email was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] on August 12, 2019, regarding “Prisoner Production” for August 13, 2019. The email included attachments: TEXT.htm, NYM_08-13-2019.pdf, and BRO_08-13-2019.pdf, and referenced document EFTA00036853 and EFTA00036854.

An email was sent from a Regional Director (Northeast Re in) to [REDACTED] on August 12, 2019, regarding a roster attached as TEXT.htm, 2019 08 11 13 01 45.pdf, and labeled “8/9/19 roster.” The email referenced document EFTA00036656.
An email chain dated August 13, 2019, discusses information related to EFTA00036634. The email includes attachments named TEXT.htm and was sent from multiple redacted email addresses.

On August 14, 2019, a Forensic Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center reported that the Suicide Watch light in Cell #1 was out due to an inmate's occupancy. The Psychologist requested immediate replacement of the light and instructed the Lieutenant to move the inmate to another cell while the repair was conducted. The email thread confirms the situation and the urgency of the repair.

The email chain discusses an “Epstein Draft” and TDY (Temporary Duty Assignment) officers from other locations (specifically, MCC NYM) assisting with overtime (OT) at the Northeast Region. Approximately 15 officers were TDY during a 30-day period, and the OT was largely provided by these additional staff. A question is raised about whether providing this information would demonstrate additional staff availability and alleviate concerns about current staff fatigue. The document includes attachments: TEXT.htm and EFTA00036618.
